_header: From Christs birth complete nine hundred year
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 440.5.
_description: John Lydgate, Guy of Warwick — 592 lines in 8-line stanzas

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Fro cristis birthe complet nyne hundrid yeer[s]twenty and seuene by
                    computacioun…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…praying echon of support and ffavournat to dysdeyne the
                    clauses whan they reede
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title: Here gynneth the lyff off Guy of Warwyk (f. 65)
BodLauMis683.Editions:
Zupitza,  Julius. 
             “Zur Literaturgeschichte des Guy von Warwick.” 
             österrichische Akademie der Wissenschaften
                Philosophisch-historische Klasse
         74 (1873): 623-45: 649-65.
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 516-38.

CamTCC601.First Lines:
fro Crystes byrthe nyne hundred yereTwenty &seuyn by
                    computacion…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…Praying echone of support and fauoureNat to dysdeyne these
                    clauses who ye rede
CamTCC601.Attributed Title: Here begynneth a tale of Guy and Colbrond

BLHar7333.First Lines:
FRome Criestes birthe complete nyen C yeereTwenty and seven by
                    computaciony
BLHar7333.Last Lines:
If owght be wrong in metre or in substauncePut al þe wyte ffor
                    dulnesse on lydegateLenoyeMekely translated vnder
                    correcciounSettyng a syde preyde and presompciouneAnd praye echoon
                    þat shalle of hit take hedeffavoure and supporte whan þei þe
                    clause Rede
BLHar7333.Attributed Title:
Here nowe begynneþe an abstracte oute of þe Croniclis / in latyn
                    made by Gyrarde Cornubyence þe worþy / Croniculer of westsexse &
                    translated in to Englisshe / be lydegate daun Johan at the requeste of margarete
                    / Countas of Shrowesbury Ladye Talbot fournyvale / and lysle of the lyf of
                    þat moste worthy knyght Guy / of warwike of whos bloode shee is lyneally
                    descendid (f. 33ra, rubric)
BLHar7333.Editions:
Hales,  John Wesley,  and  Frederick James Furnivall, eds.  
             Bishop Percy’s Folio Manuscript: Ballads and Romances.
         3 vols. London: Trübner, 1867-68: 2.520 (extract only).

BLLan699.First Lines:
FRo cristes birth compleet nyne hundred yeerTwenty & seuene bi
                    computacion…
BLLan699.Last Lines:
…Prayng echeon of support & favourNat to disdayn the
                    clauses whan they reede
BLLan699.Note: Folio number reflects the most recent foliation.
BLLan699.Attributed Title:
Incipit Guydo de warwik (f. 18); Explicit Guydo de Warwik (f.
                        27v)

PeterCentLib.First Lines:
Fro cristys byrth complete ix c yerexx and vij by
                    computacion…
PeterCentLib.Last Lines:
…Praying echon of support and fauourNot to disdeyne the
                    clauses when they rede

HarEng530.First Lines:
ffrome Cristes byrth complete nyen hundred yereTwenty & Seven
                    be computacyoun…
HarEng530.Last Lines:
…Mekely translatid vnder coreccyounSettyng a syde pryde &
                    presumpcyounAnd pray iche oon þat shall off hit take hedeffauoure
                    & support whan þey [hit rede]
HarEng530.Note: Includes envoy; last two words lost in gutter.
HarEng530.Attributed Title:
Here Nowe begynnyth An Abstracte Owte the Cronycles in latyn made by Gyrade
                    Cornubyence the worthy the Cronyculere of Westsexse & translatid into
                    Englishe by lydegate daun Johan At the Request of Margret Countasse of
                    Shrowesbury lady Talbot ffournyvalle & lysle of the lyffe of þat moste
                    Worthy knyght Guy of Warrewyk of Whos blode she is lenyally descendid (f.
                        4v)
HarEng530.Editions:
Robinson,  F. N. 
             “On Two MSS of Lydgate’s  Guy of
                Warwick.” 
             Harvard Studies and Notes in Philology
         5 (1897): 177-220: 177-220.
